thread.title: Hot air balloons take to skies over Bristol ahead of international balloon festival
thread.title_full: Hot air balloons take to skies over Bristol ahead of international balloon festival | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Kitching for MailOnline
title: Hot air balloons take to skies over Bristol ahead of international balloon festival
text:
9 shares 1
View
comments
Dozens of hot air balloons took over the skies over Bristol today as pilots from around the world prepared for the largest festival of its kind in Europe.
Colourful balloons of all shapes and sizes soared over the city in a dress rehearsal for next weekend’s Bristol International Balloon Fiesta.
Now in its 37th year, the festival wows spectators with giant balloons featuring intricate patterns or amusing shapes, including penguins.
Scroll down for video
Dozens of hot air balloons took over the skies over Bristol as pilots from around the world prepared for the largest festival of its kind
The Bristol International Balloon Fiesta features balloons of all colours and shapes, including penguins
Colourful balloons of all shapes and sizes soared over the city in a dress rehearsal for next weekend’s festival
As many as half a million visitors are expected when the event is held in Bristol over four days starting 6 August
Today’s spectacular scenes offered an entertaining display for early risers and commuters on their way to work, with many hopping out of their cars or houses to snap photos.
 Next Up all night to get lucky... footage: Fascinating drone... The hotel from hell? Horror of businessman who checked into... ‘The Queen does not live in Edinburgh Castle': Reddit users... As many as half a million visitors are expected when the event is held over four days starting 6 August.
More than 100 hot air balloons will take off from Ashton Court Estate at dawn and dusk, in sight of the Clifton Suspension Bridge.

The spectacular scenes offered an entertaining display for early risers and commuters on their way to work
Many hopping out of their cars while they were on their way to work or exited their houses to snap photos of the balloons
More than 100 hot air balloons will take off from Ashton Court Estate at dawn and dusk, in sight of the Clifton Suspension Bridge
Hailed as Europe’s largest free event, the fiesta was first held in 1979 with a mass ascent of 27 balloons, and has grown into a massive festival that attracts enthusiasts from around the world.
Organisers say the event ‘has become as much of an icon for Bristol as Brunel, Wallace and Gromit, or Concorde’.
The fiesta also includes a number of aerial displays from helicopters and aircraft, including the RAF Falcons parachute team.
Hailed as Europe’s largest free event, the fiesta was first held in 1979 with a mass ascent of 27 balloons
